result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notification of Filing of Circuit Court Record has been received by Wisconsin Court of Appeals - Appeal No 2022AP001658-CR

Per Order dated October 24, 2022, Appeal No 2022AP001658-CR, 
IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee. This order waives only the filing fees in the Court of Appeals. It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose. Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency.

Defendant Dexter  Johnson in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court for Dexter  Johnson as standby counsel.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin.   Statements heard from parties.  Case in court with 16CF1674 & 19CF2356.  Any motions to be filed by 11/1/2022. Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-29-2022
Pretrial Services Status Report

Defendant Dexter Johnson in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has had issues receiving discovery, requesting an additional status date. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Dexter Johnson in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy as stand-by counsel.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court appointed attorney Nicholas Conrardy as stand-by counsel on 04-14-2022.

Defendant Dexter Johnson in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.  Upon questioning, the Court finds the defendant competent to proceed and knowingly and voluntarily waives right to counsel. Court orders Stand-By Counsel to be appionted at County expense a the rate of $100.00 per hour. The Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning 06-01-2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Case adjourned for status conference, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Dexter Johnson in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case scheduled for status of counsel. Defense requests to proceed pro se. Court orders case adjourned for an in-person hearing.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dexter Johnson in court by video with Attorney Travis Schwantes who appears in person on behalf of Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Dexter Johnson in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Detective N. Stahl.  Court took judicial notice of 16CF1674 & 19CF2356.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CSB; Center for Animal Health; TJK

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dexter Johnson in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Dexter Johnson in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dexter Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 9.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
